subject: testing Exception subclasses
msgSnippet: ... Did you write these Exception subclasses yourself? If so, then likely you should have overloaded printStackTrace(PrintWriter) instead, in which case you
messageBody:
>Please excuse my lack of Java knowledge. Does anyone know how I can test
>overloaded printStackTrace() methods of an Exception subclass?

Did you write these Exception subclasses yourself? If so, then likely you
should have overloaded printStackTrace(PrintWriter) instead, in which case
you should test *that* method and not printStackTrace(), which is easier.
(printStackTrace() should really just call printStackTrace(System.out),
anyhow.)

Then it's really easy.

public void testStackTrace() throws Exception {
final String expectedStackTrace = "Whatever you think it should be...";
StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(sw);
try {
doSomethingThatThrowsYourException();
}
catch (YourException letUsSee) {
letUsSee.printStackTrace(pw);
assertEquals(expectedStackTrace, sw.toString());
}
}

That is an implementation pattern you can likely factor into a test method
you can use for any subclass of Exception.

JBR.
